Question: When passing a horse and rider, what should you do?

Answers.Answer: Warn the rider by sounding the horn on your vehicle
Slow down and give them as much room as you can
Warn the rider by turning your vehicle headlights on

Question: What should you do when another vehicle is following you very closely?

Answers.Answer: Speed up to get further ahead
Flick your vehicle lights and wave your arm
Slow down, move to the left and allow the vehicle to pass

Does the driver of the blue car have to give way?
Directions from a police officer overrule traffic signals, road signs and give way rules at an intersection.
If anybody is hurt in a crash, the driver must tell a police officer as soon as possible but within:
What is the maximum distance a load may extend in front of a car?

Answers.Answer: 2 metres from the front edge of the front seat
3 metres from the front edge of the front seat
4 metres from the front edge of the front seat
5 metres from the front edge of the front seat

Question: What does this road marking mean?

Answers.Answer: Vehicles displaying a mobility card may park here
You can park your wheelchair here
Wheelchair parking space for the next 30 metres

What does a reflectorised triangle placed on the side of the road mean?
Does the driver of the blue car have to give way?
What do these road markings mean?

Answers.Answer: Turning vehicles should enter turning lane at arrows and avoid striped area
Turning vehicles should avoid all road markings and use the left-hand lane
All vehicles can make a U-turn at these road markings
Turning vehicles drive straight over all road markings and wait to turn right

Question: You may park your vehicle over a fire hydrant if you:

Answers.Answer: leave your keys in your vehicle
have someone stay with the vehicle who can move it
leave a note on the vehicle saying ‘Back soon’
will not be away from the vehicle for more than 5 minutes

Question: Does the driver of the blue car have to give way?
Does the driver of the blue car have to give way?
When must you pull over and allow an ambulance or fire engine to pass?

Answers.Answer: When it is operating its siren or flashing lights
When it is turning right and you have the right of way

Question: What must be displayed on the back of a trailer being towed at night?
Who may legally require you to give a blood sample?

Answers.Answer: A police officer, an ambulance officer, other crash party
A medical doctor, other crash party, a police officer
A police officer, a medical doctor or an approved person
An ambulance driver, an approved person or a medical doctor

Question: What must you do when you come up to a red light showing at traffic signals?

Answers.Answer: Stop and then go on carefully
Go on slowly if no other traffic is coming
Stop only if other vehicles are coming from the right
Stop and wait until it changes to a green light

Question: If you have a rear tyre blowout, the vehicle will:

Answers.Answer: pull to the side with the blowout
pull away from the side with the blowout

Question: What is the minimum tread depth required for car tyres?
What does one or more yellow lights flashing at traffic signals mean?

Answers.Answer: Be careful and apply the give way rule
Drive on but increase your speed
Stop until the lights no longer flash
Move to the left-hand side of the road

Question: When driving on an unlaned road, where should your vehicle be positioned?

Answers.Answer: Anywhere, so long as you can see what is coming
Close to the centre of the road
As close to the left side of the road as possible

Question: You may use a right turn bay to overtake a vehicle travelling straight ahead.
Are you allowed to drive a vehicle with a load that is not tied on properly?

Answers.Answer: Yes – if you drive at less than 20km/h
Yes – if you put a white flag on the right-hand corner
Yes – if you think it will not come off the trailer

Question: When should you apply the 4-second rule?

Answers.Answer: Never. You should only use the 2-second rule
In wet, frosty or icy road conditions
When waiting for any vehicles coming over a one-way bridge

Question: You wish to turn left at the intersection. What should you do?

Answers.Answer: Speed up and turn in front of the cyclist
Sound the warning device to warn the cyclist
Stay back until the cyclist has passed the intersection
Keep driving to the next intersection

Question: Your vehicle has a current warrant of fitness but a rear red brake light (stop light) is not working. What should you do?

Answers.Answer: Only use the vehicle during daylight hours
Only use the vehicle in a 50km/h speed zone

Drive on because the signal will turn green

Stop only if traffic is in the way
